dc:title: Interview With Murphy
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: An interview with the Governor of Michigan and his role in settling strikes and labor disputes in a non-violent way. Highlights his views on lalw and order, but rejection of force and violence. Notes his membership in the Third Order of Franciscans.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 885 1937-10-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
